headline: Learn about the relationship between sales management and other management functions in this free online course.
description: This free online course on the fundamentals of sales management is very useful for sales managers and general sales people who wish to improve their knowledge of various sales concepts. The course describes in detail the core relationship between sales management and other functions of management. By the end of this course, you will be better informed about the importance of sales management and emerging trends in sales in an organization.

courseDescription:
This free online course begins by explaining the meaning of sales management and the evolution of sales management as a function in a sales organization. You will learn about the importance of sales management for marketing functions and for an organization. You will also learn about the relationship between sales management, personalized selling and salesmanship in a sales organization. 

The course describes the various concepts of a sales job, the changing roles of the sales force over the years, and the functions of sales executives in an organization. You will learn about the uniqueness of sales managers in a sales organization. You will also learn about the duties and responsibilities of a sales manager in a sales organization.

The course then explains how sales related marketing policies affect the growth of an organization. You will learn how companies create pricing policies which are used as customer charges and factors put in place when price decisions are made. You will also learn about how organizations decide on using strategies and tactics in achieving their sales goals.

  • Lesson Summary
    • Production concept means that in order to succeed, it is important that businesses must produce mass scale, distribute mass scale, they would achieve economies of scale
    • In the first half of the 20th century, the focus shifted from product and production to the selling concept, where again the seller remained the king
    • Specific duties and responsibilities of a sales manager include: determining the sales and objectives of the sales force, organizing sales force, sales forecasting and budgeting, sales force management 
    • Sales department is the only department that is instrumental to revenue generation 
    • The financial result of a firm depends on the performance of sales department 
    • Top management expectations include: achieving sales target, profit contributions, maintain continuous business path 
    • Personal selling involves face to face interaction between sellers and prospects, including informing and persuading the latter to enter into a transaction 
    • Sales management administers the personal selling effort, and personal selling is enacted through salesmanship
    • Selling is the transaction between the seller and the prospective buyer
    • Types of sales jobs include: retail, direct, wholesaler, manufacturer

  • Lesson Summary
    • Salesperson should get knowledge of selling and sales related marketing policies 
    • It is the responsibility of the sales executives  to administer policies that are shaped by the managers 
    • The relevance of sales marketing policies for sales personnel emerges from the fact that it impacts their function as well as the overall sales department
    • Sales policies act as directives for the sales staff with respect to planning and achievement of the overall sales objectives of the company
    • Sales related policies include: product, distribution and pricing 
    • Products determine the basic nature of a company. Product related policies are those policies which involves decisions regarding the products of the company
    • Types of product related policies include: product line, product design, product quality and service policy
    • A company in order to survive cannot ignore competitor's pricing policy. In case of price based competition, companies often price product at the same price as that of competition 
    • Strategic planning can be defined as an organizational process which helps to define an organization's long term objectives and subsequent strategies 
    • Corporate planning is usually developed at the. headquarters of a company, and the objective is drive and guide the entire organization
